2Tags for a post are defined in the post’s front matter using either the key tag for a single entry or tags for multiple entries. Since Jekyll expects multiple items mapped to the key tags, it will automatically split a string entry if it contains whitespace. For example, while front matter tag: classic hollywood will be processed into a singular entity “classic hollywood”, front matter tags: classic hollywood will be processed into an array of entries [“classic”, “hollywood”].

Irrespective of the front matter key chosen, Jekyll stores the metadata mapped to the plural key which is exposed to Liquid templates.

All tags registered in the current site are exposed to Liquid templates via site.tags. Iterating over site.tags on a page will yield another array with two items, where the first item is the name of the tag and the second item being an array of posts with that tag.
